Clean participant names from DHARMA survey data

clean_dharma_names.Rd

This function standardizes participant names from the L1_q1_name column by converting them to lowercase, replacing periods with spaces, and removing extra whitespace.

Usage

clean_dharma_names(df, name_col = L1_q1_name)

Arguments

df

A data frame containing a column named L1_q1_name with participant names.

Value

A data frame with an additional column name_clean containing the cleaned names.

Details

The function replaces literal periods (.) in names with spaces using regular expression syntax, then collapses any multiple spaces into one. This is useful for ensuring consistent formatting in name-based joins or comparisons.

Examples

df <- tibble::tibble(L1_q1_name = c("ALICE  Smith", " Bob Jones ", "c. miller"))
clean_dharma_names(df)
#> Error in mutate(., name_clean = {    {        name_col    }} %>% str_to_lower() %>% str_replace("\\.", " ") %>% str_squish()): ℹ In argument: `name_clean = `%>%`(...)`.
#> Caused by error in `str_squish()`:
#> ! could not find function "str_squish"
